Nighlight/BAby:

Nightlight singed and watch the baby, who had woken up and start to 
sniffed a strange smel. Sniff, sniff, what was that smell? it was 
mixed slighty mixed with mommy's smell but it was  diferent to 
mommy's...

What could be do?


The little one was confused, her primitive mind can't solve that 
puzzle.


 


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, aerosmith4e@a... wrote:
> Ultra Magnus sent a comm to Rodimus, "May i see you for a moment 
Rodimus?"
> > 
> > : : Rodimus Prime : : 
> > Rodimus Prime: Good, just take care of him, Flicker. 
> > Rodimus turns to see that Nightlight was trying to get up but 
was still too 
> > weak. He picks her up into his arms, along with the baby. 
> > Rodimus Prime: Well we should go to our quarters, love. You need 
to rest and the 
> > baby will need an Ionic shower(I'm stealing things from Star 
Trek again). 
> > Rodimus walks out of the Sick Bay, holding his family, and heads 
for his 
> > quarters. 
> > A lot was on his mind right now. So much had happened recently. 
His falling in 
> > love with Nightlight, the birth of their daughter, it was all 
good. He had a 
> > family. However he was still the General Commander of a Maximal 
force in the 
> > middle of the Neo Beast Wars. Not to mention that he was the 
Matrix's "Chosen 
> > One," Rodimus Prime. That meant that no telling how many past 
Decepticons and 
> > Predacons wanted him dead. Life was complicated.... 
> >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> wrote: 
Flicker::
> > 
> > "Yeah, he'll be all right."  Flicker does his best to sound 
confident.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000 <airly2002@h...>" 
> > <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > Nightlight::
> > > 
> > > "I hope..."thought Nightlight who kind heart couldn't suffer 
to see 
> > > the pain.
> > > 
> > > "Rodimus, you should better heard what Flicker have to say 
you, 
> > > perhaps could be important... "
> > > 
> > > She trie to stood up but the weakeness that she felt didn't 
let 
> > > her... She still felt tired...
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
<roborick007@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > 
> > > > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > > > Rodimus Prime: Hmm, I see. Will he be ok?
> > > >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> 
> > > wrote:Flicker::
> > > > 
> > > > "I'm not sure."  Flicker knows full well what happened, but 
he 
> > > runs a 
> > > > diagnostic scan to keep his cover safe.  "Like I said, we 
were on 
> > > our 
> > > > way to talk to you when he just ... collapsed.  Looks like 
his 
> > > neural 
> > > > net's been overloaded."
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000 <airly2002@h...>" 
> > > > <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Nightlight/Baby:
> > > > > 
> > > > > "Our child..."
> > > > > 
> > > > > That words made Nightlight smiled and look towards the 
baby who 
> > > was 
> > > > > sleeping.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Nightlight carefully moved in order to see what's going 
with 
> > > > > Condor "What's going with him???? What's happened Flicker?"
> > > > > 
> > > > > The scans showed that the baby needed a bath and 
Nightlight 
> > > needed 
> > > > > rest. Beyond that both were are right
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
<roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > > > > > Rodimus transformes to bot mode, and starts a diagnostic 
scan 
> > > on 
> > > > > Nightlight and the baby.
> > > > > > Then Flicker and Condor come in. Rodimus turns to face 
them, 
> > > and 
> > > > > sees Flicker's expression.
> > > > > > Rodimus Prime: Believe me, I know how you feel. This 
little 
> > > girl 
> > > > is 
> > > > > my...
> > > > > > Roddy stops looking at Nightlight and the child with 
much 
> > love 
> > > in 
> > > > > his face.
> > > > > > Rodimus Prime: Our child.
> > > > > > Rodimus then notices that Condor isn't speaking.
> > > > > > Rodimus Prime: What happened to Condor?
> > > > > >  "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>" <cardhead649@y...> 
> > > > wrote:Flicker::
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > The spy works quickly, short-circuiting one of Condor's 
> > memory 
> > > > > > engrams so the Maximal won't remember what happened in 
the 
> > > past 
> > > > > > hour.  Then he picks up the other bot and carries him 
inside 
> > > to 
> > > > the 
> > > > > > med-bay.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Flicker is a bit surprised when he sees Rodimus already 
> > > > > > there.  "Rodimus!  I didn't know you were back already!"
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > He hefts Condor onto an examining table, checking one 
last 
> > > time 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > make sure his 'touch-up job' can't be noticed without 
close 
> > > > > > examination.  Turning around to face Roddy and 
Nightlight, he 
> > > > > > says:  "Condor and I were on our way to tell you 
something 
> > > when - 
> > > > > oh 
> > > > > > my ..."  He gasps as he sees the infant.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000 
<airly2002@h...>" 
> > > > > > <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > nighlight::
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Nightlight move towards the medical table, and lay 
there, 
> > > she 
> > > > was 
> > > > > > > very tired but calmed down. The little one just moved 
a 
> > bit, 
> > > > > yawed 
> > > > > > > and continued sleeping in her mommy's arms
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen

> > > > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > : : Rodimus Prime : : 
> > > > > > > > Rodimus smiled at being called a father. 
> > > > > > > > Rodimus Prime: Thanks Yggdrasil. Of course if 
anything 
> > > really 
> > > > > > > serious comes up contact me. Rodimus out. 
> > > > > > > > Roddy closes the link, and waits for Nightlight and 
the 
> > > baby 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > > make it to the table.

> > > wrote: 
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil smiled wearily.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Yggdrasil: So the legendary Rodimus Prime is a

> > > > > > > > Congratulations, both of you! I'll monitor the 
battle 
> > > east, 
> > > > but 
> > > > > > I'm
> > > > > > > > not sure what I can do about it. Until then, good 
rest.

> > > > > > > > > That simple fact still shocked Rodimus in a good
